intro: Chaetanthera glandulosa var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender glandular chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, round berries that contain the seeds. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
